author: matkt0
content:
Regarding the testing call, I wanted to be sure I understand the plan

Do we want to start benchmarking on devnet3 instead of devnet 2 ?
Also are we planing to implement this https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/11323 before the benchmark ? So without knowing if we want to keep read or not inside the BALs ?

author: nero_eth
content:
We can do the execution-related benchmarking directly on devnet-2. For state-related benchmarks we may want to use devnet-2-ready clients but do so on a shadowfork of mainnet and on bloatnet as we don't have enough state on a devnet to get reasonable numbers there.

Re the cap (PR 11323): we may need it even if we get rid of the state locations that aren't changed in the BAL as clients could still intitiate a batch IO process for the remaining items (those that are changed).
For the benchmarks the PR isn't needed though - it's only a defense measure against DoS from invalid blocks and we need it for testnets at the latest. My feeling is we should do it for devnet 3 and if we then find out that we want to remove the "reads", the formula would just change from using `bal_items = storage_keys + addresses` to `bal_items = addresses`
